"if that is true the ability to dance must somehow relate to the habitlity of survive and reproduce"

That's not true ! Sexual selection can increase the proportion of gene that are a disadvantage to survive. It occurs often in birds, it's called a trade off in population genetics. The most adapted individual in a environment may not be the most adapted to have a large offspring ! In biology we use the Fitness to combine those two things, the survavibility times the fertility = fitness, and it measures how much it will be selected by evolution.

Let me offer my experience as a brilliant dancer to those who cannot dance.
I've been told, time and time again by many people that I have great moves. But often I do not think this. What dancing is about, is having the ignorance and courage to go all out in the open on the floor. It means to hear the beat of the song. When you hear the beat you are provided with a template of what to do. Like I always raise me knees in alternate fashion, and stamp them down to the beat. In other words, beat is in your legs.
The rest of the song, such as the melody and main tune dictates the style. So if it's rap music then I'll swing my arms about like a rapper. If it's a band singing I'll be really jumpy etc. if it's rock, I'll play air guitar and add a little head banging.
In truth, I've been dancing for years and I would say it's second nature for me now, to be able to get up on the floor. But what as surprised me about my supposed talent is I've never got laid. Now I can rule out bad moves as the reason for this, but it's mainly because girls will not approach you. They just don't. I've had a couple of instances where a girl has approached me. But it didn't turn into much.
So don't worry guys if you can't dance. It really isn't a big deal. It's more about how you can physically interact with a girl on the floor, not dance independently.
Oh and btw, none of this works unless you are stone cold sober and are free from drugs. Otherwise you end up blending in with everyone around you who is likely drunk.

You're confusing the layman's term for theory for what a scientific theory actually is. A scientific theory is THE most solid, evidence-supported explanation of a physical phenomena. And it's not just that they poof it out of thin air. There is evidence, evidence that you could find on your own if you actually chose to look for it instead of turning a blind eye. Theories are always under peer review, people are constantly trying to prove evolution wrong, yet it is still a hallmark of biology.

It has been observed/tested scientifically. The reason why there's a new strain of influenza every year is because it evolves. The reason why humans share 98% of our genome with chimpanzees is because both species are derived from a common ancestor. Given enough time, evolution (change), will occur. Evolution is simply change over time. You can choose to dislike a theory, but that doesn't make it untrue.

When you speak, you hear the sound from the very short distance from your mouth to your ears. When you record it, the sound travels across a much greater distance, is affected by temperature, quality of the walls that the sounds bounce off of, etc. An easy way to hear how you sound to other people is to put your hands up and block the direct path from your mouth to your ear. Start by covering your ears with your hands, then fold them open, your hands facing behind you.

Skin is constantly exposed to potential irritation. Itching, also known as pruritus, starts with some kind of external stimuli, including bugs, dust, clothing fibers and hair. When the stimuli lands on your skin it will begin to rub back and forth on your skin. Once the hair or dust scratches your skin's surface layer, receptors in the dermis of the skin will become irritated. These receptors send a signal through fibers in the skin to your cerebral cortex in your brain. (You feel an itch.)
